eligibleGroups: Adults and children with long-term health conditions (e.g., diabetes, heart disease, respiratory conditions)
Carers and close contacts of immunocompromised individuals
flu.vaccinationInfo: Free flu vaccination is available through your GP practice or local pharmacy for eligible groups. Book now to protect yourself and others this winter.

eligibleGroups: Residents in care homes for older adults
Adults aged 6 months to 64 years in clinical risk groups
Frontline health and social care workers
Pregnant women (at any stage of pregnancy)
Household contacts of people with weakened immune systems
covid19.bookingInfo: Book your COVID-19 vaccination through your GP practice, use the NHS website booking system, or call 119 (free from mobiles and landlines).

keyMeasures: Continuous surveillance of respiratory viruses (influenza, COVID-19, RSV)
National stockpiles of PPE, ventilators, and medical equipment
Rapid response plans for emerging infectious disease threats
Vaccination infrastructure ready for rapid mass deployment
publicGuidance: Get vaccinated against flu and COVID-19 if you are eligible
Wash hands regularly with soap and water for at least 20 seconds
Cover coughs and sneezes with a tissue (catch it, bin it, kill it)
Stay home if unwell with respiratory symptoms (fever, cough, cold)
Wear face coverings in healthcare settings when advised
Ensure good ventilation in indoor spaces
Consider wearing a face covering in crowded indoor settings during high transmission periods

nhs111.description: For medical help when it's not life-threatening

nhs999.description: For life-threatening emergencies (severe breathing difficulty, chest pain, loss of consciousness, severe bleeding)

gpSurgery.description: Contact your GP practice for non-urgent medical advice, vaccinations, and health checks

pharmacyAdvice.description: Local pharmacies offer free NHS health advice and minor ailment consultations
